intro: Trema, commonly known as the "false elder" or "bush willow," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It consists of several species, many of which are native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia. The plants typically have woody stems, palmate leaves, and showy, five-petaled flowers that are often pink or purple in color. Trema species are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. They also play a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and birds.
